tp:treatment-sec.p:
Aenigmatoconcha sumonthai
has a narrow distribution, with populations living on a few limestone hills in Chumphon Province ( Fig. 1 ). We extended our survey, especially among limestone sites about 200 km southwards down to southern peninsular Thailand , but we could not find this species elsewhere.

The lack of a penial sheath and flagellum in the male reproductive organs of
A. sumonthai
was originally reported to be similar to
A. clivicola
(Tumpeesuwan & Tumpeesuwan, 2018: 174, fig. 6). In this study, based on topotypic specimens, however,
A. sumonthai
was found to have a large and thickened penial sheath and small flagellum encircled with loose tissue ( Fig. 8 ).
